# Conditional Text Extension Demo

This document demonstrates the conditional text extension for Quarto. Select a language above to see customized content.

## Block-level Conditional Content

Here's how to read data from a CSV file:

::: {.conditional-text version="v2026.01"}
### version 2026.01.0 Example

Use pandas to read CSV data:

```python
import pandas as pd
data = pd.read_csv('data.csv')
print(data.head())
```
:::

::: {.conditional-text version="v2.0"}
### version 2.0 example

Use readr to read CSV data:

```r
library(readr)
data <- read_csv('data.csv')
head(data)
```
:::

::: {.conditional-text version="v3.0"}
### version 3.0 Example

Use CSV.jl to read CSV data:

```julia
using CSV, DataFrames
data = CSV.read("data.csv", DataFrame)
first(data, 5)
```
:::

## Inline Conditional Content
